general_advisory: As per Extended Range Forecast of IMD, rainfall is above normal and both maximum and minimum temperature is expected to be normal for Odisha state during 7th to 13th July, 2024 so, farmers are advised to take necessary action towards kharif crop cultivation and avoid irrigation during that period. Farmers should start nursery bed preparation for kharif paddy and vegetable crops and also start planting new fruit crops in orchard by taking the advantage of past rainfall condition.

advisory: By taking advantage of previous rainfall farmers should start field preparation for nursery sowing of Paddy. Wet bed nursery should be selected for assured irrigated areas close to source of irrigation water with good drainage facilities. Divide nursery area into smaller plots of 1.5-metre-long, 10-15 cm height and convenient length. Irrigation channels of size 30 cm in width should be made along the beds for irrigation/drainage.
Before sowing, seed treatment should be done with Carbendazim 50% WP @ 2g/kg of seeds or Trichoderma @ 10 g/kg of seeds.
Soak the seeds in water for 24 hours and then drain out the water and keep the seeds in a gunny bag. Once the seeds sprout, use it for sowing.
Farmers those are not yet started field preparation for cultivation of cotton crop are advised to start the preparation as soon as possible.

Farmers may use a seed rate @ 800-1500 g per acre. Before sowing, seed should be treated with imidacloprid 70 WG @ 7 g/kg of seed for protection against sucking pests. Spacing should be 90 × 45-60 cm and 90-120 × 90 cm for normal and hybrid variety respectively.

Fertilizer Application: For Hybrid varieties 48 kg Nitrogen, 24 kg each Phosphorus and Potash whereas 32 kg Nitrogen, 16 kg each Phosphorus and Potash for normal varieties should be recommended. All Phosphorus and Potash and 1/4th of Nitrogen should be applied as basal and the rest amount of nitrogen should be applied in 2 splits.

Farmers those are already done sowing, advised to thin weaker plants in the cotton field at 10-12 days after germination and gap filling is done with planting of seedlings raised in polythene bags. Keep the field weed-free up to 60 days after sowing.

Past weather (periodically cloudy and sunny) condition is favorable for sucking insect pest attack in vegetable crops so its regular monitoring should be advised. If the attack of those insects is noticed, then spraying of Thiamethoxam 25% WG @ 0.5-0.6g or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 0.5ml per liter of water should be advised.

As there is a chance of occurrence of rainfall is expected in upcoming days, farmers are advised to take proper care while conducting spraying operations and also start nursery bed preparation and sowing of kharif vegetable crops with proper protection.
Deworming and vaccination of animals against FMD, HS, and BQ should be ensured at the beginning of the rainy season to prevent infectious diseases.
Soft and tender grass is more palatable to cattle, but magnesium deficiency is seen in dairy cows when eating too much litter, so a variety of grasses should be fed instead of just soft grass.
During the rainy season, make provision to ensure proper ventilation for poultry farming.
The drainage ditch around the shed should be clear/clean to avoid pests.
Deworming and vaccination of poultry birds against ranikhet disease must be ensured.
